meanings.definition: The state of being adjacent or close to something else.
meanings.sent1: The subjacency of the two buildings made it easy to walk from one to the other.
meanings.sent2: The subjacency of the park to the school allows for easy access to outdoor activities.
meanings.sent3: The subjacency of the cat to the dog's bed led to an unexpected friendship.
meanings.sent4: The subjacency of the flowers to the fence created a beautiful border for the garden.
meanings.sent5: The subjacency of the book to the lamp made it convenient for reading at night.

meanings.definition: The quality of being situated beneath or below something else.
meanings.sent1: The subjacency of the basement to the house provides extra storage space.
meanings.sent2: The subjacency of the roots to the tree anchors it firmly in the ground.
meanings.sent3: The subjacency of the blanket to the pillow kept them warm and cozy.
meanings.sent4: The subjacency of the fish to the coral reef creates a vibrant underwater ecosystem.
meanings.sent5: The subjacency of the rug to the floor prevents slipping and adds comfort to the room.
